content.raw:
You’re completely right this was a bad choice. It was probably because there’s no Twist message in Gazebo defined yet. 

@{557058:5de38267-b118-494c-aa76-4fab35448816} @{557058:6ff86fcb-b7ab-44a5-b8a6-f6d9cae8b6e8} Is it okay to add a message similar to `geometry_msgs::Twist` from ROS? And can I change it in the plugin API for Gazebo 9, or should I retain the old \(wrong?\) topic type and add a new one with Twist type?
content.html:
You’re completely right this was a bad choice. It was probably because there’s no Twist message in Gazebo defined yet.

@Steve Peters @Louise Poubel Is it okay to add a message similar to geometry_msgs::Twist from ROS? And can I change it in the plugin API for Gazebo 9, or should I retain the old (wrong?) topic type and add a new one with Twist type?
